alert.note: Alert for Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 08 at 3:43PM CST until further notice by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Arkansas and Oklahoma, including the following counties, in Arkansas, Crawford, Franklin, Madison, Sebastian and Washington AR. In Oklahoma, Adair, Haskell, Latimer and Sequoyah. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 341 PM CST, Several public reports of flooding in the advisory area, especially in the Van Buren area. Minor flooding is ongoing and is expected to continue for several more hours. Widespread 2 to 3 inch rains have fallen across the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Sallisaw... Stilwell... Ozark... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Alma... Muldrow... Roland... West Fork... Arkoma... Mulberry... Dyer... Altus... Keota... Red Oak... Mccurtain... Winslow... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
